page.title: 03CHEVERELLS,MARKYATE
page.content: Cheverells is a country house near Markyate,owned by Mrs.Gamble.It has had some connection with royalty, visited by Edward VI as a stained glass window in the porch commemorates The last brick was laid in 1707 by William Willingdon.The house is used as an old people's home,with 6 inmates ,4 women and 2 men.Downstairs there is a lovely ball room and the Pine Room. The former was used as a common room when Cheverells was occupied by the Women's Land Army in World War II. The Pine Room has a lovely carved wooden fireplace.The four acre gardens are delightful with maze-like walls and sunken gardens.The tennis courts have now replaced the old peach-houses.
